tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: (2) York, 5 January, 1808. Regarding report from Joseph Chenique.
(Enclosed in Thomas Scott to Gore, 4 November, 1807.)
Resignation as chaplain to the Legislative Council, Kingston, 15 Sept. 1807.
Transmits a return of pork inspected.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosing his answers to Gore's queries.
Enclosing a correspondence between Capt. Muir and Mr. Cheniquy.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Acknowledges despatches.
States that neither Mrs. Guroe nor her sons can be granted land free from fees.
Same to the same. Report on the error in a deed in favour of the Earl of Selkirk.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Stating that the distance from Morgan's Point to Queenstown is 26?? miles; the marsh in Wainfleet as surveyed in 1794 contained 30,000 acres.
Stating that he has delivered the keys of the House to Isaac Pilkington, keeper of the Court of King's Bench.
tagPerson: MacLean, Donald, Clerk of the House

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) Niagara, 6 May, 1808, Washington. Regarding seizure of Indian goods by U.S. Customs.
Seeking a commission as halfpay officer.
Asking permission to have firewood for the House of Assembly cut in the Government park.
Has received half-pay as a reduced Captain in Butler's Hangers since 1784.
Certificate of the death of Solomon Hill, signed by Robert Nelles and R. Clench, 1 Nov. 1807.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Petition of James & Isaac McCrea for permission to settle on land formerly granted to their father Samuel McCrea in Montague Twp.
Enclosing the petition of Mary Brisco. (Petition not at this place.)
Angus McDonald certifies that he has received halfpay as a lieutenant in the Duke of Cumberland's Regt. since 1783.
John Bethune states that he has received half-pay as chaplain in the late 84th. Foot since 1784.
Transmits letter from D.M. Erskine regarding the mission to Washington. Deplores lack of efficiency in Indian Dept.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Queries submitted to Sir James Craig by Lt.-Col. Shaw on behalf of Lt.-Col. Gore, 1 Dec. 1807.
Enclosure: May 28, 1806.
Order to complete the survey of the township of Pittsburg. (Order for survey in Chewett and Ridout to Wm. Hatton, January 21, 1807.)
Enclosing depositions relative to a conspiracy in the Province.
States that he has received half-pay as lieutenant in H.M. Six Nation Indian Dept. since 1784.
Notifying him that Joseph Willcocks has taken oaths as member of the House of Assembly.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Requests permission to cut firewood for his own use on the government park.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: June 21, 1808. Return of pork.
Regrets that he is unable to meet him as requested.
Enclosing the plan of a road connected with Lower Canada. (Plan not here enclosed.)
Petition by sundry persons in favour of William Smith for a mill site in the Mississagua purchase. (Minute. Granted by the President.)
Enclosed: 20 Dec. 1806
Regarding a proposed meeting. Aggressions on the part of the Indian Dept. on board the Camden. Gives assurance of continued peaceful relations.
Enclosing letters from Rev. Alex. McDonell and Capt. Thomas Fraser, offering their services to take out a number of deeds to persons in their districts.
Enclosed: Feb. 27, 1807. Report.
Acknowledging Letters and packets which have been forwarded.
Requests explanation of order regarding documents in his office.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Giving authority for the survey of a tract of land near Gwillimbury.
Return of 13 half-pay officers in the Eastern district.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Same to the same. Transmit certificates in favour of William Graves. Mr. Sherwood presents himself for license. (Certificates not at this place.)
Alex. McMillan certifies that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in General Delancy's battalion since 1783.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Robert Nelles to same. Regarding concession lines to run through Grimsby and Saltfleet.
A Copy of Lieut.-Governor Hunter's order permitting searches to be made in the Secretary's Office on land matters - 1 June 1803. Handed by Wm. Jarvis, 3 Sept. 1807.
Has prepared a second commission for Moses David.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Andrew Denyke and Samuel Hitchcock, ferrymen between Kingston and Wolfe Island, request grants of privilege to prevent interference.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Respecting the organizing of the Glengarry Highlanders. Transmits letter from Miles McDonell to Halton.
States that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in Butler's Rangers since 1784.
Wm. Jarvis to same. Regarding commissions for clerk of the peace, Newcastle district.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Certificate of the qualification of William Graves as surveyor.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Stating that he has delivered warrant of suspension to C.B. Wyatt, Surveyor General, and a commission to Messrs. Chewett and Ridout as acting surveyors.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Requests a grant of land in Grantham township for David Haines, son of the original owner.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Stating that the lots on which the owners had not paid road duty are in Trafalgar.
Announcing their appointment as joint surveyors.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Testimonial from Peter Howard for William Graves.
Reports the lease to Amos Leach is dated 1802.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: Estimate for survey of remaining part of Township of Pittsburgh, 30 Jan. 1807.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: George Lawe to same. Seeking employment on any public works.
John Gamble, surgeon in late Queen's Rangers, certifies that he has received half-pay since 1802.
Enclosure: Nov. 27, 1806 Estimate.
Transmits schedule of patents impounded for erroneous description. [Schedule not at this place]
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Hazelton Spencer and Timothy Thompson certify they have received half-pay as lieutenant and ensign in the late King's Royal Regt. of New York since 1784.
Acknowledges receipts enclosed with leases.
Paul Trumpson certifies that he has received half-pay as an Ensign since 1783.
Authorized payment for secret service.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Regarding the survey of the Township of Pittsburgh.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Transmits documents regarding seizure of eight boats, filled with merchandise for the Indians, by the American customs at Niagara.
States that George Rudeloff is not entitled to receive land.
Thomas Reynolds, commissary. Account of deficiencies on provisions received from Fort Erie and issued at Amherstburgh from 25 June, 1806 to 20 January 1807.
Relating to Indians on the pay list. (Extract.)

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Report survey of a road between Kempenfelt Bay on Lake Simcoe and Penetanguishene Bay on Lake Huron.
Requests permission to print a proclamation to establish a fair in Glengarry county.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Report of survey on Lake Simcoe.
Inhabitants of Sandwich to Hon. James Baby. Seeking military protection for the district.
Regarding an additional stand of arms for the Upper Canada Militia.
Receipted bill for cloth bought by Land from Robert Smith.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Same to the same. Reports a gore of land in Rainham township not in survey.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: William Crawford certifies that the has received half-pay as ensign in H.M. late Royal Regiment of New York since 1784.
Acknowledging secret letter of 27 June.
Enclosed: D.M. Erskine, Washington, 17 February, 1808, to Craig. Sees no hope of success for Rose's mission.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Requesting orders regarding the King's vessels at Kingston.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Recommendation by the magistrates in favour of G. Fitzgerald.
Alex. McDonell to same. Transmits resolution of the House. (Enclosure not at this place.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Acknowledges receipt of Sir John Wentworth's warrant appointing him deputy surveyor of woods.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Samuel Anderson states that he has received half-pay as a reduced captain in the King's Royal Regt. of New York since 1783.
Deposition of Simon Mabee relative to a supposed conspiracy in the Province. (Enclosed in Thomas Welch to Halton, 17 June, 1807.)
Enclosed: (2) Deposition of Simon Mabee, 11 April, 1807.

tagPerson: Powell, Jonathan, Clerk of Leg. Council
tagDescription: Acknowledges letter appointing day for opening of Parliament.
Joseph Ryerson states that the has received half-pay as a lieutenant since 1783.
Recognizance of Alex. McInnes and Archibald Kincaid.
Information communicated by Colonel Hull to Adam Brown, on probable troubles between Canada and the United States.
Transmits copy of Reuben Sherwood's survey of Crosby.
Enclosed: (2) Sketch of the town of Kingston.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Return of the members who composed the Board of Accounts assembled at Quebec, 4 April, 1808.
(Enclosed in 23 Dec. 1806.)
John McDonell states that he has received half-pay as a reduced captain in Butler's Rangers since 1784.
Stating that the timber on an island opposite Bridgewater Mills need not be reserved for military purposes.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: J. Small to same. Reports an error in Lord Selkirk's patent requested.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Reporting the sheriffs who have entered into Bonds in eight districts.
Report on lots Nos. 16 and 17 in the township of Etobicoke.
Enclosed: Answers to queries submitted by Lt.-Col. Shaw, 1 December 1807.
Robt. Thorpe returned a Member of the Assembly, in place of Wm. Weeks.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Regarding his application for irons for a sawmill.
On his perusal of General York. Prescott's commission.
Enclosed: (4) Deposition of Ethan Woodruff of Charlotteville, 26 March 1807.
Government debtor to half fees on land to U.E. Loyalists under regulations of 10 July 1797, acted upon 22 Dec. following - Signed by Lt. Governor Gore.
Transmits proceedings of a Board of Survey held on a barrel of liquor for the Lt. -Gov.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Recommending the Abbe McDonell and Catholics in Upper Canada to his care.
tagPerson: Plessis, J. O., R.C. Bishop of Quebec

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Regarding Tunis Cronk who has occupied a lot on Long Point Bay since 1795. Transmits surveyor general's report on Cronk's land.
Edward Jessup certifies that he has received half-pay as a major in the late Loyal Rangers since 1783.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Complains of damage done by workmen and agents of Messrs. Muir and Joliffe. Informs him that some Americans have settled on land intended for Highlanders.
Enclosing the Report of the survey of South and North Crosby. (Enclosure in Chewett and Ridout to Halton, 28 Jan. 1807.)
General Orders. Court martial of Capt. Hector McLean 10th Royal Veteran Battalion.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: General Orders. Regarding increased price of meat.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Memorandum by Wm. Stanton respecting barrack furniture in Government House and books in the Library.
Extract of the letter preceding.
Memorial of William Jarvis for permission to retain patent fees until 30 June.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Remarks on the Quebec. possible issue of the pending controversy with the United States.
Enclosed: (1) Kingston, 19 April, Application for sawmill irons as in above list.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Request to borrow Statutes of L.C. from 1801-1806.
Transmits abstract of land in Upper Canada which have passed the great seal between 1 Jan. and 31 Dec. 1806. (Abstract not at this place.)
Acknowledging receipt of his letter appointing 20 Jan. 1808, as opening of Parliament.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Requests provisions due to a servant of his in 1792.
Enclosed: June 1, 1807. Report on land occupied by Tunis Cronk.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosing location papers for Jacob Osborne in Uxbridge.
Extract from instructions to Sir James Craig, Governor in Chief of Canada.
Has received half-pay as reduced captain in the Six Nation lndian Dept, since 1784.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Complain of waste of timber and injury to settlers caused by contractors for cutting masts in Eastern and Johnstown districts Mr. Joliffe has threatened all complainants.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: June 4, 1808, Kingston. Proceedings
Neil McLean states that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in the 84th Regt. of Foot in 1784
Regarding John Smith's location at Pickering.
Transmit Order for survey of township of Pittsburgh.
His opinion on the legality of a notice in Council.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Acknowledges letter forwarded from New York. Immense quantities of produce arrive from Lake Champlain in spite of embargo.
Memo on the petition of Elijah Ketchum.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosing schedule of Acts of the last provincial parliament. (Enclosure not at this place.)
A commission of the Peace for the District of Niagara will be prepared.
Enclosing estimate for repairs necessary for the Assembly chamber.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Extract of a letter from his Royal Highness the commander-in-chief, to Gen. Sir James Craig, concerning the militia in Canada.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: D. Cameron acknowledges proclamation for holding a fair in Glengarry County.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Thomas Clark's land location authorized.
Schedule of Acts passed in the third session of the 4th. Provincial Parliament.
Acknowledging the receipt of the letter appointing the meeting of parliament.
tagPerson: McLean, Donald, clerk of the House of Assembly

tagDescription: Extract from preceding letter.
Forwards a box containing minutes of the Executive Council from 4 Sept. to 5 August, 1807.
Has directed that a second deed be issued to Adam Spencer.
Stating that he has received half-pay as lieutenant in H.M. Corps of Loyal Rangers since 1784.
Enclosed: John Ferguson, Kingston, 6 April, 1808, to Langan. Respecting Wolfe Island.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Ebenezer Washburn to same. Is leaving York and leaves his land and business to Allan McLean.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Authority to erect a lighthouse at Gibraltar Point.

tagPerson: Ridout, Thos., Clerk of the Peace
tagDescription: Owners of Lots. Nos. 1 and 2 seek indemnity for Yonge Street encroaching on their land.
Regarding locations in Salt fleet.
Statement of his half-pay as ensign in the late Loyal American Regt. since 1783.
Enclosed: (1) Deposition of Daniel McCall, Jr., of Charlotteville, 13 June 1807.
Request for Â£150 for circuit money in advance.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Easter Graves has made her location in North Crosby.
Copy of Lieut.-Governor Hunter's Order of 16 January 1804 rescinding his order of June 1, 1803, respecting searches on land business. Enclosed:
Relative to runaway slaves and deserters.
Elias Jones to same. Acknowledges appointment as clerk of the court, Newcastle district.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Deposition of John McNelley, of Woodhouse, relative to a supposed conspiracy in Upper Canada. (Enclosed in Thomas Welch to Halton. June 17, 1807.)
Enclosed: (3) Deposition of John McNelly of Woodhouse, 15 May 1807.
Referring to Hudson's location of land.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagPerson: Barclay, Thomas, H. M. Consul at New York
tagDescription: Regretting lack of arrangements between postmasters at York and New York for forwarding letters.
Requesting leave of absence.
Has received the description of Cossins and sent parties to look for him. Encloses receipt for a box shipped on the schooner Duke of Gloucester.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Regarding the deficiency of certain concession lines in Augusta, Yonge, Elizabethtown, Lansdown and Leeds townships.
Statement of provisions required for Upper Canada from 1 October 1808 to 1 October 1809.
Appointing a meeting place on Gross Isle.
Same to the same. Report on land for G. Playter and family.
Repairs required for stove pipes in House of Assembly.
States that he is a reduced 2nd. Lieutenant in Butler's Rangers on half-pay since 1784.

Stating that the R.C. Bishop of Quebec had ordered the Irish friar, Father Fitzsimmons, to leave the province, but consented to his remaining until spring. Recommends his immediate removal. Suggests Scots Catholic Clergy be employed. Mentions intrigues of the St. Regis Indians.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Regarding Lord Castlereagh's despatch on the militia.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Forwarding 50 copies of the Judicature Bill.
Reports his having called out the militia; and list of officers recommended for promotion dated, Dec. 14, 1807.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Requests Wm. Jarvis be directed to return certain money Bills to clerk of the House.
Has sent parchment to the Lt. Governor's office.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: States that he has been in receipt of half-pay as an ensign since 1787.
States he is unable to obtain Rev. Alex. McDonell's patents from Wm. Jarvis without paying exhorbitant fees.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Acknowledging letter and stating that he will inform the members that parliament meets on 2 February 1807.
tagPerson: Clark, James, Clerk of the Legislative Council

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Thomas Merritt to same. Reports mast cutting in Eastern and Johnstown districts for the navy. Transmits lists of persons licenced to cut masts.
Authority to complete the survey of North Gwillimbury.
Thanking him for appointing Francis Baby as Lieutenant of the County of Essex.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Report of survey in Clinton township. David Betron and Ezekiel Dennis have petitioned for grants there.
Memorial for land.
Requests his influence in obtaining land for a loyalist friend, whose services have been overlooked.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Report on town lots at Sandwich for a school and market.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) Return of the militia in his Majesty's province of U.C., York, 5 January, 1808.
Regarding location papers for John Martin.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Henry Young certifies that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in the King's Royal Regiment of New York since 1784.
Same to the same. Enclosing form of certificate for officers in command at York, to be transmitted every 24 June and 24 December to Quebec, for command money.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Joseph Jessup certifies that he has received half-pay as a reduced captain of Loyalists since 1783.
Repairs to House of Assembly examined and found satisfactory.
Acknowledges despatches to which he has replied.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Joseph Clement states that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in the Six Nations Indian Dept. since 1784.
Informing him that he has no more Secretary's parchment for deeds.
Application for two reams of paper for Surveyor General's office.
Extract of a letter from Viscount Castlereagh to Craig. Regarding militia training.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Transmitting the resignation of Rev. Dr. John Stuart as chaplain of the Executive Council, and recommending that his son Rev. George O. Stuart be appointed to that office. Enclosed:
Instructions for laying out a tract of land near Gwillimbury received.
Has received half-pay as lieutenant in late King's Rangers since 1783.
Notifying him that Joseph Willcocks has been dismissed from the office of sheriff.
Regarding his half-pay as captain the late regiment of Guides and Pioneers in 1783.
Thanks him for the use of Government House.
Regrets illness prevents his attending parliament.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: (1) Jan. 28, 1807.
Allan MacDonell states he has received half-pay as a captain lieutenant in the late Royal Regt. of New York since 1783.
Enclosing the President of the United States' proclamation respecting British ships of War. Enclosed:
Applying for stationery for the Surveying Department.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Same to the same. Protest against retention of patent fees by Jarvis. Requests permission to investigate.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Transmits letter from John Ferguson regarding Wolfe Island.
Barclay Fanning states he has received half-pay as lieutenant in the King's late American Regt. of Foot since 1783.
Requests information regarding land grants to prospective settlers from the West Indies.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Stating a location in Wolford township is authorized to Thomas Lake.
John McGill to same. Regarding deeds made out for N.B. Barnum.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosing proceedings of Council on the 18th instant. (Enclosure not at this place).
Transmits estimate of the expense to survey the remaining part of Pittsburgh Township.
Wm. Jarvis account against the surveyor general's office.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Requests glass to repair Government House windows.
Unsigned draft of a letter re document alluded to in former letter of same date.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Miles MacDonell, sheriff, to same. Requests authority to employ Beikie as deputy sheriff.
Report on certain lots of land in Sidney and Thurlow.
Enclosed: July 2, 1007 Receipt.
Respecting a commission for Mr. McLean as inspector of beef and pork.
Enclosed: Capt. Miles McDonell, Glengarry, 15 March, 1808. Regarding the defence of the country.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Proposing a meeting.
Regarding a deed for Ebenezer Collier.
Regarding repairs needed on Government buildings before the House meets.
tagPerson: McDonell, Alex., speaker, House of Assembly

tagDescription: Surrendering his commission as Sergeant at Arms.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Lt.-Col. Thornton offers his services in forwarding despatches.
Enclosing a statement and distribution of provisions for the troops from 1 Oct. 1808 to 1 Oct. 1809 inclusive. (Statement not at this place.)
Concerning the question of a possible war and need of arms and ammunition.
On the completion of the survey of Crosby and Pittsburg.
Gives his opinion on use of Great Seal on land deeds.
Calling his attention to the state of the boundary of Upper Canada in case of a rupture with the United States. Enclosed:
Will commence the examination of the Secretary and Registrars offices as soon as his health permits.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Has forwarded papers on foreign relations lately laid before Congress. Various matters relating to American policy.
States he has been on half-pay as Quartermaster in the Queen's Rangers of cavalry since 1783.
Enclosing copy of a letter from D'Arcy Boulton.
Respecting Mr. Speaker McDonell's intention of changing locations as heir at law for his brother.
Enclosed: (2) Report of the Survey of South and North Crosby, Dec. 11, 1806. Copy 28 Jan. 1807.
John McGill to same. Transmits a sealed packet containing an abstract account of payments made from 1 January to 31 December, 1807.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: States that he received half-pay as Town Sergeant since 1786.
Has received half-pay as ensign in the New Jersey volunteers.
Asking permission to occupy Gov't. House in Montreal.
tagPerson: Dunn, Thomas, President of the Council

tagDescription: Excuses for his absence as legislative councilor.
Referring to the actions of Darius Herns in connection with land grants.
Recommending Michael Hammon for land.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Report on the petition of Samuel Sherwood and Peter Howard regarding several settlements in Johnstown district.
Regarding his half-pay as lieutenant in the King's Regiment of Foot in 1783.
Oliver Church certifies that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in the late King's Royal Regt. of New York since 1784.
States that he has received half-pay as ensign in the 103rd Regt. of Foot since 1783.

tagPerson: Pyke, George, Deputy surveyor general of woods
tagDescription: Enclosing sundry papers from Sir John Wentworth, surveyor general of woods. [Enclosures not at this place.)
Authorizing the Receiver General to retain Â£150 of his fees for so much advanced for parchment and wax.
Respecting deed for land purchased by Mr. Jarvis on the Grand River.
Schedule of the town of York for persons who have received grants of land therein.
Copy of the Political and Commercial Register, Philadelphia, 6 July 1807.
Recommend completion of survey of Johnstown district.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosing petition from sundry inhabitants of the Midland District for town lots in Kingston.
Transmits General Orders of 12th and 13th instant. (See above.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Testimonial that William Graves is an inhabitant of Elizabethtown township of good character.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Transmit report on petition of Messrs. Sherwood and Howard. (Report not at this place.)
William Francis regarding his half-pay as quartermaster in H.M. American Dragoons in 1783.
Reports on the petitions of Arch. McGilvray, Donald McDonald, John McDonell, and Roderick Urquhart, of Lancaster.
Informing him that the Great Seal of the province is in need of repair.
Enclosed: (4) Fort Niagara, 25 May, 1608, Declines to interfere in affair of the Indian goods boats detained by U.S. o officials.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Asking Permission to have cord wood cut for the House from the Crown reserve. (granted)
Pay lists for 1807 were forwarded to the Supt. General's office at Montreal in June last.
Certificate of the qualifications of Jonathan Rogers to be a surveyor.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Same to the same, Transmits annual account of purchases for troops from 25 December, 1806 to 24 December, 1807. (Account not at this place.)
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Regarding his half-pay as ensign in Major Jessup's regiment since 1784.
States he has received half-pay as captain in the late King's American Dragoons since 1783.
Con. Skinner certifies as to character of John Parker, 10 August, 1805.
Chewett and Ridout report on the gore in Clinton.
James Green regarding excess charged. (Copy.)

Informing him that sureties proposed by the sheriff of the Home District are insufficient.
Regarding his half-pay as lieutenant in Major Jessop's regiment in 1784.
Col. Brock's orders regarding pay, Quebec, 18 Nov. 1806.
States that he has received half-pay as a lieutenant in Jessup's Rangers in 1783.
Reports on the petition of Ephraim Jones for land in Augusta Township.

tagDescription: Has refused certain land patents on account of erasures. Asks his assistance.

tagDescription: Regarding his half-pay as ensign in the Royal Nova Scotia Volunteers since 1783.
Enclosing petition of Catherine Cryderman requesting that it be forwarded to Samuel Sherwood for enquiry as it bears the marks of forgery. (Petition not at this place.)

Receipt for a barge for the Governor's use.
States that he has received half-pay as lieutenant in Butler's Rangers since 1784.

tagDescription: Chewett and Ridout to same. Regarding lots in Thurlow township granted to Jane Hutchinson.

Informing him that no sheriff has been appointed in the place of Cornelius Munro of Grenville.

tagDescription: Regarding land for his [Craig's] friend.
Requesting the name of the person to be appointed Returning Officer.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Thomas Fraser to same. Complains that damaged cannon given him by the Lt. Gov. have been taken and sold by Samuel and Gideon Adams.
B. Mallory to same. Has discovered iron ore on the Grand River and wishes to erect iron works. Has a contract with the Indians for some of their land.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Report on lots in Sidney and Thurlow. The gore between Camden and Portland may be located.

tagDescription: Informing him that free transportation has been provided for his stores from Lower Canada.
Respecting the Township of Lancaster.

Enclosing commission ordered. (Commission not at this place.)
Referring to broken lots in the Mississagua purchase on Lake Ontario.
Gives details of his services with the Royal family, their promises of land and General Hunter's approval of his appointment as German interpreter for U.C. Solicits assistance of Lt.-Gov. Gore.

tagDescription: Stating that Henry Brandts is settled on Lot No. 3, at Cramahe.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: States that his only report from D.M. Erskine [British representative in the U.S.] tells of general American displeasure over Chesapeake affair. Defence of province hardly practicable owing to inertia, sedition, immigration of Americans, and insufficient militia. Transmits a return of the militia. Outlines his views for defence. Provisions on hand sufficient. Sole source of revenue is from Great Britain. Stresses importance of keeping up appearance of defending Amherstburg on account of the confidence it inspires in the Indians. Captain Elliott's influence with the Indians. Presents for the Indians an urgent necessity. Mentions power an Indian called the prophet has over his people.
Enclosed: (3) Queenston, 23 May, 1808, Niagara. Report of customs incident sent to the U.S. president.
tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808

tagDescription: Enclosed: Thomas Reynolds, commissary, February 3, Amherstburg, to John Craigie.
